briefTitle: Analyzing the Relationship Between Speed Propofol is Given and Low Blood Pressure
officialTitle: Analyzing the Relationship Between Rate of Induction and Perioperative Hypotension Using Propofol

arms.label: Group A- propofol given at FDA approved administration speed
Group B- propofol given over 120 seconds

summary: The objective of this study is to evaluate the hemodynamic changes related to Propofol administration rate. We hypothesize that slow administration of IV propofol will have less hemodynamic disturbances and will require less amount of vasoactive medication for BP correction when compared to standard FDA approved administration rate.

primaryOutcome.measure: Patients Administered Propofol at a Slower Rate of Infusion Will Have Lower Incidence of Post Induction Hypotension Than Patients Administered Propofol at FDA Approved Rate.

effectByArm.arm: Group A- Propofol Given at FDA Approved Administration Speed
Group B- Propofol Given Over 120 Seconds
